roleset.name: create, make

example.name: just transitive
example.text: Peter Drake, biotechnology analyst for Vector Securities International, Chicago, thinks market uncertainty may encourage small companies to form more strategic alliances with big corporations.
example.arg: more strategic alliances with big corporations

example.name: passive, with source
example.text: [NCNB Texas National]-1, formed *trace*-1 from the remnants of of the failed First RepublicBank Corp. of Dallas, contributed $76.9 million to NCNB's bottom line in the third quarter.
example.arg: from the remnants of of the failed First RepublicBank Corp. of Dallas

roleset.note: Comparison with 'create'. Nominal 'forming' based on BOLT-7. Member of VNcls create-26.4, appear-48.1.1, reflexive_appearance-48.1.2.

example.name: nominal rel: forming
example.text: ---------------------- The forming of a market involves a process . This process may be very tortuous . At present , this market is in the process of forming .

example.name: cf. 'make up'
example.text: Commission income from domestic stock and bond sales accounts form a large portion of Japanese securities companies' earnings.
example.arg: Commission income from domestic stock and bond sales accounts
a large portion of Japanese securities companies' earnings

example.name: comprise again
example.text: The labels were breathy: ``Within its sheltering walls is a microcosm of a thousand years in garden design ... [a rose garden, herb garden, serpentine garden, flower fields, an apple orchard]-1 ... organized in a patchwork of 50-by-50-foot squares [*]-1 to form `rooms'...

predicate.note: Frames file for 'form' based on sentences in financial subcorpus.
